## [[Hyper[links]{.underline}]{.flowery .Bigger}](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn_web_development/Howto/Web_mechanics/What_are_hyperlinks)

:::{.panel-tabset}
### External {{< iconify streamline-sharp-color:link-share-2-flat >}}

::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="55%"}
```{r}
#| eval: false
#| echo: true

---
format: 
  html:
    link-external-icon: true       #<1>
    link-external-newwindow: true  #<1>
    other-links:                    #<2>
      - text: Extra Special Stuff!!
        icon: alarm
        href: https://quarto.org/   #<2>
---
  
<https://quarto.org/> 
      
{{< iconify noto:fight-cloud size=3x >}}

[Quarto](https://quarto.org/)
        
        
        
#
  
```
1. both of these [can also be applied only to targeted links](https://quarto.org/docs/output-formats/html-basics.html#external-links): `[example](https://example.com){.external target="_blank"}`
2. `code-links` and/or `other-links` [creates a right--hand margin](https://quarto.org/docs/output-formats/html-basics.html#code-links-and-other-links) isolation for important resources. Icons available at <https://icons.getbootstrap.com/>.

:::

### Cross--references {{< iconify noto-v1:back-arrow >}}

::: {.Smaller}

::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}

{{< iconify icon-park:one-key >}} identify object via [element id (`#`) or code cell `label`](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/figures.html#cross-references):

`![Lookie Here](figure.png){#fig-pretty}`, or

```{r}
#| echo: fenced
#| label: fig-pretty
#| fig-cap: "Lookie Here"

ggplot(penguins, aes(x = bill_depth_mm, 
  y = bill_length_mm , color = species)) +
  geom_point()

```
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}

{{< iconify icon-park:two-key >}} reference object within document using `@`:

```{r}
#| echo: true

Please see @fig-pretty

```

Please see @fig-pretty2
:::

:::

:::

![](https://pngimg.com/d/chain_PNG103425.png){.absolute right="30" bottom="0" height="200"}

### PDFs {{< iconify material-icon-theme:pdf >}}

::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="46%"}

External window opening up instead of "within current tab" not supported natively because {{< iconify fa6-regular:file-pdf >}}s don't utilize tabs. 

:::

::: {.column width="8%"}
:::

::: {.column width="46%"}

Functionality needs to be controlled via viewer settings on your handler (or by [creating a customized {{< iconify devicon:lua >}} filter](https://quarto.org/docs/extensions/filters.html)).  

:::

:::

:::
